qas.question: Who was appointed as second in command to Lor Loudoun in 1756?
Who led New France reinforcements in 1756?
When did England formally declare war on France?
Who was appointed as third in command to Lor Loudoun in 1756?
Who was appointed as second in command to Lor Loudoun in 1765?
Who didn't led New France reinforcements in 1756?
Who led New France reinforcements in 1765?
When did England formally end war on France?

context: Newcastle replaced him in January 1756 with <a0_1><a1_2>Lord Loudoun<a1_2/><a0_1/>, with <a0_0><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4><b3_0><b4_0>Major General James Abercrombie<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_0/> as his second in command. Neither of these men had as much campaign experience as the trio of officers France sent to North America. French regular army reinforcements arrived in New France in May 1756, led by <a1_0><a1_1><a1_3><a1_4><b5_0><b6_0>Major General Louis-Joseph de Montcalm<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_1/><a1_0/> and seconded by the Chevalier de Lévis and Colonel François-Charles de Bourlamaque, all experienced veterans from the War of the Austrian Succession. During that time in Europe, on <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><b7_0>May 18, 1756<b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, England formally declared war on France, which expanded the war into Europe, which was later to be known as the Seven Years' War.
